abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Development Banking Project
            will support the Government's current program to reduce
            over time distortions affecting Brazilian trade and
            industrial development; will provide needed medium- and
            long-term resources, principally to small and medium
            enterprises (SME) which in recent years have suffered the
            most from the acute shortage of such resources; support
            BNDES' efforts to strengthen the institutional
            capabilities and financial condition of state development
            banks, including their evaluation and supervision of
            projects; and will support a work program to undertake
            studies laying the groundwork for industrial policy changes.
